title: 115_s761
content: The "Health Care Options Act of 2017" allows for premium assistance credit for insurance outside an exchange. The "Health Care Options Act of 2017" allows for premium assistance credit for insurance outside an exchange, with special rules for certain off-exchange plans under Section 36B of the Internal Revenue Code. The "Health Care Options Act of 2017" provides special rules for off-exchange plans under Section 36B of the Internal Revenue Code, including adjustments to clauses in subsections (b)(3)(B), (c)(2)(A), and (d)(3)(B) for taxpayers residing in specific areas designated by the Secretary. The "Health Care Options Act of 2017" establishes rules for off-exchange plans under Section 36B of the Internal Revenue Code. These rules apply to taxpayers residing in areas where no qualified health plans are offered through an Exchange. Plans must be authorized by the state and not offered through an Exchange or be a not-for-profit organization providing health care benefits. The "Health Care Options Act of 2017" establishes rules for off-exchange plans under Section 36B of the Internal Revenue Code. These rules apply to taxpayers residing in areas where no qualified health plans are offered through an Exchange. Plans must be authorized by the state and not offered through an Exchange or be a not-for-profit organization providing health care benefits. The Act excludes off-exchange plans from advance payments and reporting requirements under certain sections of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act and the Internal Revenue Code. The return for taxable years before January 1, 2020, must include a statement confirming coverage not enrolled in through an Exchange, premiums paid, months of coverage, and adjusted monthly premium for the second lowest cost silver plan for each month. For taxable years before January 1, 2020, individuals residing in exempted areas may be waived from the individual mandate if the Secretary of Health and Human Services certifies their rating area or county. Human Services certifies that no qualified health plans are offered through an Exchange established under Section 1311 of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable and plan years beginning after December 31, 2017.
